description2:
The aim of the studies is to prepare for work in the field of social prevention and addiction therapy. The studies develop knowledge and practical educational skills. Moreover, they allow gaining knowledge about therapeutic activities using the most modern techniques and methods for working with socially maladjusted children and youth and/or those addicted to drugs or psychotropic substances.

The studies prepare graduates to diagnose social maladjustment and conduct therapeutic sessions (group and individual) with children and youth from so-called risk groups (children and youth raised in dysfunctional families, diagnosed with emotional disorders, behavioral disorders, and on the verge of social maladjustment).

description4: The studies are qualification-oriented, the program of this field is compliant with legal regulations, taking into account the requirements specified in the Regulation of the Minister of Science and Higher Education of July 25, 2019, on the standard of education preparing for the teaching profession (Journal of Laws 2019, item 1450 as amended). The condition for completing postgraduate studies is obtaining credits, including internship credits (90 h), and passing the diploma exam.

faculty: The program will be conducted by a qualified team of specialists in the fields of psychology, psychiatry, addiction therapy, and other related disciplines. The faculty will include both academic lecturers and practitioners with many years of clinical experience.

  • The remaining 50% can be completed:

    • in educational institutions,
    • in counseling centers,
    • other.
evaluation: The assessment of learning outcomes will be based on: preparation of a project work in the area of Psychology of Addictions with Addiction Therapy
jobOpportunities: Graduates of the 'Psychology of Addictions with Addiction Therapy' program will be prepared to work in various therapeutic institutions, such as addiction treatment centers, mental health clinics, psychiatric hospitals, as well as in non-governmental organizations dealing with addiction prevention and therapy. Additionally, they will be able to run their own therapeutic practice and participate in scientific research and prevention programs.
